name: Psychiatry Sections
description: Section classification for psychiatric clinical notes (9 classes)

classes.name: Chief Complaint
classes.description: The patient's main presenting problem or reason for visit stated in their own words. Chief complaint, CC, presenting problem, main issue, reason for visit.

classes.name: History of Present Illness
classes.description: Detailed narrative of the current psychiatric symptoms including onset, duration, severity, course, triggers, and associated symptoms.

classes.name: Past Psychiatric History
classes.description: Previous psychiatric diagnoses, hospitalizations, treatments, and responses to treatment.

classes.name: Substance Use History
classes.description: History of alcohol, tobacco, drug use, and other substance use including frequency and amount.

classes.name: Family Psychiatric History
classes.description: Psychiatric illnesses in family members. Family history, hereditary mental illness, genetic predisposition.

classes.name: Social History
classes.description: Patient's living situation, occupation, education, relationships, support system, and lifestyle.

classes.name: Mental Status Examination
classes.description: Objective clinical observations: appearance, behavior, speech, mood, affect, thought process, cognition, insight, judgment.

classes.name: Assessment
classes.description: Clinical diagnostic impression, risk assessment, DSM/ICD diagnosis, differential diagnosis, and formulation.

classes.name: Plan
classes.description: Treatment recommendations including medications, therapy, referrals, safety planning, and follow-up.
